properties.description: The study focuses on idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM), a significant cause of heart failure and heart transplantation. Left ventricular reverse remodeling (LVRR) is an important factor in reducing mortality and improving cardiac function in DCM.

Despite improvements in heart failure treatment, LVRR occurs in only a proportion of DCM patients. Early identification of patients likely to undergo LVRR could improve patient management and therapeutic strategies.

There is a lack of early prediction models for LVRR in patients with first-diagnosed idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy, leading to challenges in prognostic stratification and management of the condition.
